bibl.title: Jennie Miller Powers v. Mary Elizabeth Miller and R.J. Miller. Civil
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding Terms at Seattle, for the Counties of King and Kitsap.
The People of the United States of America to the Sheriff Mary Elizabeth Miller & RJ Miller of King County Greeting:

We command you, that you have the body of Mary Alice Powers by you imprisoned and detained as it is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention, by whatsoever name said Mary Alice Powers shall be called or charged, before the HON. ROGER S. GREENE Richard A Jones Judge of the aforesaid Court at his chambers in the Court House in Seattle King County W.T. on the 10th day of April A.D. 1888 at the hour of 10 oclock AM to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the said Mary Alice Powers And have you then and there this writ.
WITNESS THE HON. ROGER S. GREENE Richard A. Jones Judge of said District Court, and the seal thereof this 9th day of April A.D. 1888
